q: What is the most common type of head and neck cancer?
a: Mouth cancer is the most common type of head and neck cancer.

q: What are the symptoms of mouth cancer?
i: Mouth ulcers and unexplained, persistent lumps in the mouth.
a: Symptoms of mouth cancer can include mouth ulcers and unexplained, persistent lumps in your mouth, both of which may be painful.

q: Where does laryngeal cancer develop?
a: Laryngeal cancer develops in the tissue of the larynx (voice box).

q: What are the symptoms of laryngeal cancer?
a: Symptoms of laryngeal cancer can include a change in the voice, difficulty or pain when swallowing, noisy breathing, shortness of breath, a persistent cough, and a lump or swelling in the neck.

q: Do doctors use the term 'throat cancer'?
a: Doctors do not tend to use the term 'throat cancer', as the throat (pharynx) includes many different parts that can be affected by cancer.

q: Which areas can be affected by throat cancer?
a: The main areas that can be affected by throat cancer are the oropharynx, hypopharynx, and nasopharynx.

q: What are the symptoms of cancer in the oropharynx or hypopharynx?
a: The most common symptoms of cancer in the oropharynx or hypopharynx include a lump in the neck, a persistent sore throat, and difficulty swallowing.

q: Which glands does salivary gland cancer most commonly affect?
a: Salivary gland cancer most commonly affects the parotid glands.

q: What is the main symptom of salivary gland cancer?
a: The main symptom of salivary gland cancer is a lump or swelling on or near your jaw, or in your mouth or neck. But most of these lumps are non-cancerous.

q: What parts of the nasal and sinus area can be affected by cancer?
a: Nasal and sinus cancer affects the nasal cavity and the sinuses.

q: What are the symptoms of nasal and sinus cancer?
a: The symptoms of nasal and sinus cancer include a persistent blocked nose, nosebleeds, a decreased sense of smell, and mucus running from the nose or down the throat.

q: Which part of the throat does nasopharyngeal cancer affect?
a: Nasopharyngeal cancer affects the part of the throat that connects the back of the nose to the back of the mouth.

q: What are the symptoms of nasopharyngeal cancer?
a: Symptoms of nasopharyngeal cancer can include a lump in the neck, a blocked or stuffy nose, nosebleeds, and hearing loss (usually only in 1 ear).
